headline: Nvidia Fails to Reassure—Heard on the Street Recap
summary: Nvidia’s shares fell 5.5% despite record income as investors' high expectations for AI bellwethers continue to create a difficult bar for companies to clear.  One particular problem, notes Heard columnist Dan Gallagher, is that the company’s runaway success could be seen as a sign of the destabilization to come, given the massive amounts of capital-spending filling its coffers are financially weakening the world’s largest companies from Amazon to Microsoft.  The Nasdaq and S&P 500 both declined following Nvidia's slide, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average remained relatively flat and Treasury yields inched lower.

raw.headline: Nvidia Fails to Reassure—Heard on the Street Recap
raw.summary: Nvidia’s shares fell 5.5% despite record income as investors' high expectations for AI bellwethers continue to create a difficult bar for companies to clear.  One particular problem, notes Heard columnist Dan Gallagher, is that the company’s runaway success could be seen as a sign of the destabilization to come, given the massive amounts of capital-spending filling its coffers are financially weakening the world’s largest companies from Amazon to Microsoft.  The Nasdaq and S&P 500 both declined following Nvidia's slide, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average remained relatively flat and Treasury yields inched lower.

headline: Google & Samsung's Warby Parker AI deal, Krispy Kreme skyrockets
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Josh Lipton tracks Thursday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Shares of JM Smucker Company (SJM), the maker of JIF peanut butter and Folgers coffee, are on the rise after the company reported better-than-expected quarterly results. Warby Parker (WRBY) stock is surging as the company partners on artificial intelligence (AI) glasses with Google (GOOG, GOOGL) and Samsung (005930.KS). Krispy Kreme (DNUT) stock is skyrocketing amid the company's turnaround efforts. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: J.M. Smucker Stock Is Surging After Earnings. It Needs a Boost.
summary: Shares of  J.M. Smucker  jumped Thursday after the company reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings and struck a deal with activist investor Elliott Investment Management.  The company, which owns brands like Jif peanut butter and Folgers coffee, posted adjusted earnings of $2.38 a share for its fiscal third quarter, ahead of Wall Street’s forecast of $2.27.  Smucker also announced the appointments of Woo-Sung (Bruce) Chung and David Singer to its board, effective April 15, following discussions with Elliott.

raw.headline: J.M. Smucker Stock Is Surging After Earnings. It Needs a Boost.

The company, which owns brands like Jif peanut butter and Folgers coffee, posted adjusted earnings of $2.38 a share for its fiscal third quarter, ahead of Wall Street’s forecast of $2.27.  Smucker also announced the appointments of Woo-Sung (Bruce) Chung and David Singer to its board, effective April 15, following discussions with Elliott.

headline: This Food Stock Is the S&P 500’s Top Performer Today. It Needs a Boost.
summary: Shares of  J.M. Smucker  jumped Thursday after the company reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings, providing a glimmer of hope in a downtrodden packaged-food category.  The company, which owns brands like Jif peanut butter and Folgers coffee, posted adjusted earnings of $2.38 a share for its fiscal third quarter, ahead of Wall Street’s forecast of $2.27.  Shares were up 9% this year through Wednesday’s close as Wall Street rotated out of riskier growth stocks and into consumer staples.

The company, which owns brands like Jif peanut butter and Folgers coffee, posted adjusted earnings of $2.38 a share for its fiscal third quarter, ahead of Wall Street’s forecast of $2.27.  Shares were up 9% this year through Wednesday’s close as Wall Street rotated out of riskier growth stocks and into consumer staples.

headline: Smucker: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: ORRVILLE, Ohio (AP) — J.M. Smucker Co. (SJM) on Thursday reported a loss of $724.2 million in its fiscal third quarter. The Orrville, Ohio-based company said it had a loss of $6.79 per share. Earnings, adjusted for asset impairment costs and non-recurring costs, were $2.38 per share.

headline: J. M. Smucker (NYSE:SJM) Exceeds Q4 CY2025 Expectations, Stock Soars
summary: Packaged foods company J.M Smucker (NYSE:SJM) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 7% year on year to $2.34 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.38 per share was 5.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: The J.M. Smucker Co. Appoints Two New Independent Directors
summary: The J.M. Smucker Co. today announced it has appointed Woo-Sung (Bruce) Chung and David Singer to its Board of Directors, effective April 15, 2026. With the addition of Chung and Singer, the Board will comprise 11 directors, 10 of whom are independent, and all of whom are focused on advancing the work underway to drive continued growth, enhanced profitability, and disciplined capital allocation for the Company.

raw.headline: The J.M. Smucker Co. Appoints Two New Independent Directors

headline: The J.M. Smucker Co. Announces Fiscal 2026 Third Quarter Results
summary: The J.M. Smucker Co. (NYSE: SJM) today announced results for the third quarter ended January 31, 2026, of its 2026 fiscal year. Financial results for the third quarter of fiscal year 2026 reflect the divestiture of certain Sweet Baked Snacks value brands on March 3, 2025, and the divestiture of the Voortman® business on December 2, 2024. All comparisons are to the third quarter of the prior fiscal year, unless otherwise noted.
